@DWFireRescue @DorsetCouncilUK @HealthyDorset @EnvAgency @dorsetpolice @DSFireUpdates @danny_m_1

@mike_r_edwards @Sutcliffe_Park @EnvAgencySE @Thames21 @johnjimson @Royal_Greenwich Do you mean at this end of the #RiverQuaggy? It‚Äôs understandable that debris would collect at the river‚Äôs exit of the park. It didn‚Äôt look too bad at the time. Not enough to cause a major blockade, at least not today. Will keep an eye on.

Fire @DorsetCouncilUK Crookhill Depot, Chickerell, #Weymouth now under control. But there has been significant damage. No reported injuries so far, but please remain vigilant and follow @HealthyDorset advice. Thanks also to @EnvAgency @dorsetpolice @DSFireUpdates CFOüöíüëç https://t.co/EtbTIaGSsU

@Sutcliffe_Park @EnvAgencySE @Thames21 @qwag @johnjimson I wonder if @Royal_Greenwich have actually got around to clearing the outflow in the north west corner. It was blocked with a huge amount of debris that was drastically reducing flow out of Sutcliffe Park and needs to be sorted.

With more rain forecasted we getting to very high level of flood via River Quaggy, normally river is about four feet below bridge. But floods do recede quickly. Not had flood gates shut yet by @EnvAgencySE, @Thames21 @qwag pic by @johnjimson https://t.co/1fF9zB7glJ

We have issued a Flood Warning in Essex for Bumpstead Brook through Steeple Bumpstead to New England. River levels have risen due to the rainfall this morning but are expected to start to drop back to more normal levels later today.
#FloodAware 
https://t.co/lKpGYasH8s https://t.co/5a9kbLVTQR

Numbers of salmon & sea trout in rivers of Britain & Europe have crashed to only 7% of those present 50 years ago, acc 2 the first global study by the world‚Äôs most respected conservation organisations.

In Britain main problem‚Äôs plummeting water quality. & we do what, @EnvAgency? https://t.co/7tcdeR6d5I

tweets.text: @DrElaineKing @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @ShaunSpiers1 @NickMolho Funding is good, but implemented powers is better. Organisations such as @EnvAgency need to exercise powers they already have (which they‚Äôre not currently).  Just look at state of #chalkstreams
Winterbourne is flowing. Murky brown https://t.co/mktRyX3maA
Flood warnings have reduced in the South West but a number remain on the coasts ahead of this evening‚Äôs high tide https://t.co/QdPKdEYx15 https://t.co/LPtFS5RA1c

West Dereham Fen on the River Wissey. An amazingly beautiful November morning. I think it's one of the loveliest parts of England and very unknown..

@FascinatingFens @FenlandFlag @ScholarGypsyOx @EDP24 @EnvAgencyAnglia https://t.co/4QGqmjYEUv

Beautiful brown trout filmed this week in the #Trent at @StaffsUni. Fish of this size may now be reaching this part of the river because the new channel at the Victoria Ground bypasses two weirs, which were a barrier to fish passage. 
@EnvAgencyMids @CraigBennett3 @WildTroutTrust https://t.co/B65vmWzYs9

River word of the day: riffle! This is an area where shallow water flows rapidly over gravel, agitating the flow. As a result the water here is highly oxgenated, which is favoured by spawning trout and bullheads. Lots of riffles in the new channel in #StokeOnTrent!
@EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/ewsqvsq1Sz

The labours of Sisyphus sometimes spring to mind!

The time-periods covered are also often too short to deliver nature‚Äôs recovery. https://t.co/A7BcKF98l7

The latest river level for Cookham Lock is 19cm and rising. @EnvAgencySE tends to call a Flood Alert at 20cm. We can keep up to date by registering for flood alerts by text, phone or email. Latest Cookham flood info. at Cookham Flood Warnings blogspot https://t.co/BDBUl8Nt2A

@BeaverTrust @ninaconstable @sophiepavs @jaowallace @NatureTrustEU @HFFnature @kernowbeaver @gow_derek @rcampbellpalmer @fishinguideuk @DefraGovUK Woohoo we're in! Get involved with some Sunday evening feet up beaver time if you've not made plans yet üçøüíöü¶´üåçüìΩÔ∏è @Lukesteele4 @forus_tree @slowtheflow_UK @treesponsibilit @CrownTrees @YorkshireiCASP @EnvAgencyYNE @ScottAPatient

‚ö°Ô∏èLINK TO WATCH THE PREMIERE‚ö°Ô∏è of #BeaversWithoutBorders is HERE!! üé¨ü¶´üêæ

Click @ 19:00 TONIGHT to be the first to watch, then stay for LIVE Q&A with @ninaconstable & @sophiepavs!

‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/4CzJyCnksJ

Register here for event details & reminders üîî https://t.co/hdVBJPp0eg https://t.co/UIBX36LnTC
@LymoTweetUp @EnvAgency @Lymingtontimes @KenWhistance Oh, dear! I was walking along the sea wall between Lym and KH this morning and lots of flooring. This is bonkers though!

The #Ineson2020 Lecture is going virtual!! Save the date: 26th November 4pm-5:30pm. This years lecture, joint with @Geolsoc_hydro& @IAH_Ireland will be delivered by Anne Dacey, DD for Water @EnvAgency, discussing the future of UK #groundwater post-2020. More info to follow soon! https://t.co/wjZHfWZaQu

Large waves along the coast in parts of North-West, South and South-West England today & Yorkshire and the North-East tomorrow could lead to minor flooding. 

Minor river impacts are also expected today in South-East England. 

Sign up for flood warnings: https://t.co/60gMJ48T7b

Volunteers are key for improving community resilience and being prepared. 

Contact the @CwllCFloodForum, @DevComsTogether
 or the @EnvAgencySW to see if a local flood group is set up near you. 

#Devon #Cornwall #IslesofScilly #BeFloodReady https://t.co/0Hqfkmx67z
